refsynopsisdiv.title: Synopsis

refsect1.title: Description
refsect1.para: The GScanner and its associated functions provide a general purpose lexical scanner.

refsect2.title: GScanner
refsect2.para: The data structure representing a lexical scanner.

You should set input_name after creating the scanner, since it is used by the default message handler when displaying warnings and errors. If you are scanning a file, the file name would be a good choice.
The user_data and max_parse_errors fields are not used. If you need to associate extra data with the scanner you can place them here.
If you want to use your own message handler you can set the msg_handler field. The type of the message handler function is declared by GScannerMsgFunc.

refsect2.title: g_scanner_new ()
refsect2.para: Creates a new GScanner. The config_templ structure specifies the initial settings of the scanner, which are copied into the GScanner config field. If you pass NULL then the default settings are used.

refsect2.title: GScannerConfig
refsect2.para: Specifies the GScanner settings.
cset_skip_characters specifies which characters should be skipped by the scanner (the default is the whitespace characters: space, tab, carriage-return and line-feed).
cset_identifier_first specifies the characters which can start identifiers (the default is G_CSET_a_2_z, "_", and G_CSET_A_2_Z).
cset_identifier_nth specifies the characters which can be used in identifiers, after the first character (the default is G_CSET_a_2_z, "_0123456789", G_CSET_A_2_Z, G_CSET_LATINS, G_CSET_LATINC).

cpair_comment_single specifies the characters at the start and end of single-line comments. The default is "#\n" which means that single-line comments start with a '#' and continue until a '\n' (end of line).
case_sensitive specifies if symbols are case sensitive (the default is FALSE).
skip_comment_multi specifies if multi-line comments are skipped and not returned as tokens (the default is TRUE).
skip_comment_single specifies if single-line comments are skipped and not returned as tokens (the default is TRUE).
scan_comment_multi specifies if multi-line comments are recognized (the default is TRUE).
scan_identifier specifies if identifiers are recognized (the default is TRUE).
scan_identifier_1char specifies if single-character identifiers are recognized (the default is FALSE).
scan_identifier_NULL specifies if NULL is reported as G_TOKEN_IDENTIFIER_NULL. (the default is FALSE).
scan_symbols specifies if symbols are recognized (the default is TRUE).
scan_binary specifies if binary numbers are recognized (the default is FALSE).
scan_octal specifies if octal numbers are recognized (the default is TRUE).
scan_float specifies if floating point numbers are recognized (the default is TRUE).
scan_hex specifies if hexadecimal numbers are recognized (the default is TRUE).
scan_hex_dollar specifies if '$' is recognized as a prefix for hexadecimal numbers (the default is FALSE).
scan_string_sq specifies if strings can be enclosed in single quotes (the default is TRUE).
scan_string_dq specifies if strings can be enclosed in double quotes (the default is TRUE).
numbers_2_int specifies if binary, octal and hexadecimal numbers are reported as G_TOKEN_INT (the default is TRUE).
int_2_float specifies if all numbers are reported as G_TOKEN_FLOAT (the default is FALSE).
identifier_2_string specifies if identifiers are reported as strings (the default is FALSE).
char_2_token specifies if characters are reported by setting token = ch or as G_TOKEN_CHAR (the default is TRUE).
symbol_2_token specifies if symbols are reported by setting token = v_symbol or as G_TOKEN_SYMBOL (the default is FALSE).
scope_0_fallback specifies if a symbol is searched for in the default scope in addition to the current scope (the default is FALSE).

refsect2.title: g_scanner_input_file ()
refsect2.para: Prepares to scan a file.

refsect2.title: g_scanner_sync_file_offset ()
refsect2.para: Rewinds the filedescriptor to the current buffer position and blows the file read ahead buffer. This is useful for third party uses of the scanners filedescriptor, which hooks onto the current scanning position.

refsect2.title: g_scanner_input_text ()
refsect2.para: Prepares to scan a text buffer.

listitem.simpara: the length of the text buffer.

refsect2.title: g_scanner_peek_next_token ()
refsect2.para: Gets the next token, without removing it from the input stream. The token data is placed in the next_token, next_value, next_line, and next_position fields of the GScanner structure.

Note that, while the token is not removed from the input stream (i.e. the next call to g_scanner_get_next_token() will return the same token), it will not be reevaluated. This can lead to surprising results when changing scope after peeking for the next token. Getting the next token after switching the scope will return whatever was peeked before, regardless of any symbols that may have been added or removed in the new scope.

refsect2.title: g_scanner_get_next_token ()
refsect2.para: Gets the next token, removing it from the input stream. The token data is placed in the token, value, line, and position fields of the GScanner structure.

refsect2.title: g_scanner_cur_line ()
refsect2.para: Gets the current line in the input stream (counting from 1).

refsect2.title: g_scanner_cur_position ()
refsect2.para: Gets the current position in the current line (counting from 0).

listitem.simpara: the current position on the line.

refsect2.title: g_scanner_cur_token ()
refsect2.para: Gets the current token type. This is simply the token field in the GScanner structure.

refsect2.title: g_scanner_cur_value ()
refsect2.para: Gets the current token value. This is simply the value field in the GScanner structure.

refsect2.title: g_scanner_eof ()
refsect2.para: Returns TRUE if the scanner has reached the end of the file or text buffer.

listitem.simpara: TRUE if the scanner has reached the end of the file or text buffer.

refsect2.title: g_scanner_set_scope ()
refsect2.para: Sets the current scope.

refsect2.title: g_scanner_scope_add_symbol ()
refsect2.programlisting: void g_scanner_scope_add_symbol (GScanner *scanner, guint scope_id, const gchar *symbol, gpointer value);
refsect2.para: Adds a symbol to the given scope.

refsect2.title: g_scanner_scope_foreach_symbol ()
refsect2.programlisting: void g_scanner_scope_foreach_symbol (GScanner *scanner, guint scope_id, GHFunc func, gpointer user_data);
refsect2.para: Calls the given function for each of the symbol/value pairs in the given scope of the GScanner. The function is passed the symbol and value of each pair, and the given user_data parameter.

listitem.simpara: the function to call for each symbol/value pair.
user data to pass to the function.

refsect2.title: g_scanner_scope_lookup_symbol ()
refsect2.para: Looks up a symbol in a scope and return its value. If the symbol is not bound in the scope, NULL is returned.

listitem.simpara: the value of symbol in the given scope, or NULL if symbol is not bound in the given scope.

refsect2.title: g_scanner_scope_remove_symbol ()
refsect2.para: Removes a symbol from a scope.

warning.para: g_scanner_freeze_symbol_table has been deprecated since version 2.2 and should not be used in newly-written code. This macro does nothing.
g_scanner_thaw_symbol_table has been deprecated since version 2.2 and should not be used in newly-written code. This macro does nothing.

refsect2.title: g_scanner_lookup_symbol ()
refsect2.para: Looks up a symbol in the current scope and return its value. If the symbol is not bound in the current scope, NULL is returned.

listitem.simpara: the value of symbol in the current scope, or NULL if symbol is not bound in the current scope.

refsect2.title: g_scanner_warn ()
refsect2.para: Outputs a warning message, via the GScanner message handler.

listitem.simpara: the message format. See the printf() documentation.
the parameters to insert into the format string.

refsect2.title: g_scanner_error ()
refsect2.para: Outputs an error message, via the GScanner message handler.

listitem.simpara: the message format. See the printf() documentation.
the parameters to insert into the format string.

refsect2.title: g_scanner_unexp_token ()
refsect2.programlisting: void g_scanner_unexp_token (GScanner *scanner, GTokenType expected_token, const gchar *identifier_spec, const gchar *symbol_spec, const gchar *symbol_name, const gchar *message, gint is_error);
refsect2.para: Outputs a message through the scanner's msg_handler, resulting from an unexpected token in the input stream. Note that you should not call g_scanner_peek_next_token() followed by g_scanner_unexp_token() without an intermediate call to g_scanner_get_next_token(), as g_scanner_unexp_token() evaluates the scanner's current token (not the peeked token) to construct part of the message.

listitem.simpara: a string describing how the scanner's user refers to identifiers (NULL defaults to "identifier"). This is used if expected_token is G_TOKEN_IDENTIFIER or G_TOKEN_IDENTIFIER_NULL.
a string describing how the scanner's user refers to symbols (NULL defaults to "symbol"). This is used if expected_token is G_TOKEN_SYMBOL or any token value greater than G_TOKEN_LAST.
the name of the symbol, if the scanner's current token is a symbol.
a message string to output at the end of the warning/error, or NULL.
if TRUE it is output as an error. If FALSE it is output as a warning.

refsect2.title: GScannerMsgFunc ()
refsect2.para: Specifies the type of the message handler function.

listitem.simpara: TRUE if the message signals an error, FALSE if it signals a warning.

refsect2.title: g_scanner_destroy ()
refsect2.para: Frees all memory used by the GScanner.

refsect2.title: enum GTokenType
refsect2.programlisting:
typedef enum { G_TOKEN_EOF = 0,
G_TOKEN_LEFT_PAREN = '(', G_TOKEN_RIGHT_PAREN = ')', G_TOKEN_LEFT_CURLY = '{', G_TOKEN_RIGHT_CURLY = '}', G_TOKEN_LEFT_BRACE = '[', G_TOKEN_RIGHT_BRACE = ']', G_TOKEN_EQUAL_SIGN = '=', G_TOKEN_COMMA = ',',
G_TOKEN_NONE = 256,
G_TOKEN_ERROR,
G_TOKEN_CHAR, G_TOKEN_BINARY, G_TOKEN_OCTAL, G_TOKEN_INT, G_TOKEN_HEX, G_TOKEN_FLOAT, G_TOKEN_STRING,
G_TOKEN_SYMBOL, G_TOKEN_IDENTIFIER, G_TOKEN_IDENTIFIER_NULL,
G_TOKEN_COMMENT_SINGLE, G_TOKEN_COMMENT_MULTI, G_TOKEN_LAST } GTokenType;
refsect2.para: The possible types of token returned from each g_scanner_get_next_token() call.

refsect2.title: union GTokenValue
refsect2.para: A union holding the value of the token.

refsect2.title: enum GErrorType
refsect2.programlisting: typedef enum { G_ERR_UNKNOWN, G_ERR_UNEXP_EOF, G_ERR_UNEXP_EOF_IN_STRING, G_ERR_UNEXP_EOF_IN_COMMENT, G_ERR_NON_DIGIT_IN_CONST, G_ERR_DIGIT_RADIX, G_ERR_FLOAT_RADIX, G_ERR_FLOAT_MALFORMED } GErrorType;
refsect2.para: The possible errors, used in the v_error field of GTokenValue, when the token is a G_TOKEN_ERROR.

listitem.simpara: digit beyond radix in a number.

refsect2.title: G_CSET_a_2_z
refsect2.para: The set of lowercase ASCII alphabet characters. Used for specifying valid identifier characters in GScannerConfig.

refsect2.title: G_CSET_A_2_Z
refsect2.para: The set of uppercase ASCII alphabet characters. Used for specifying valid identifier characters in GScannerConfig.

refsect2.title: G_CSET_DIGITS
refsect2.para: The set of digits. Used for specifying valid identifier characters in GScannerConfig.

refsect2.title: G_CSET_LATINC
refsect2.para: The set of uppercase ISO 8859-1 alphabet characters which are not ASCII characters. Used for specifying valid identifier characters in GScannerConfig.

refsect2.title: G_CSET_LATINS
refsect2.para: The set of lowercase ISO 8859-1 alphabet characters which are not ASCII characters. Used for specifying valid identifier characters in GScannerConfig.
